pullRequest.title: Add region filter to world quick-hopping
pullRequest.bodyText: This enhancement will add an option to the World Hopper plugin that will limit the quick-hop feature to worlds of a given region.

nodes.bodyText: Maybe the switch can be eliminated by storing the WorldRegion mapping in RegionFilterMode. This way you can do something like world.getRegion() != config.quickHopRegionFilter().getRegion() to filter by world.
{ needs to be on a new line. You can run Maven with <checkstyle.skip>false</checkstyle.skip> instead of true in pom.xml to find style errors like this one.

nodes.bodyText: I think it would be better to put this here: https://github.com/runelite/runelite/blob/master/runelite-client/src/main/java/net/runelite/client/plugins/worldhopper/WorldHopperPlugin.java#L563 instead, since it's separate to the world type checking.
This key name should match the method name

beforeCommit.message: Fix config item and remove unused import

afterCommit.message: Fix config item and remove unused import

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -561,6 +561,12 @@ private void hop(boolean previous)
 
 			world = worlds.get(worldIdx);
 
+			// Check world region if filter is enabled
+			if (config.quickHopRegionFilter() != RegionFilterMode.NONE)

nodes.bodyText: This should use the stored pings
The default behavior should not be changed

beforeCommit.message:
Add check to ensure quick-hopping possible
This commit adds a check for the ping limiter ensuring there are worlds with a lower ping than what is provided in the config. If there are none, it won't check and will warn the player.

afterCommit.message:
Add ping limiter to quick-hop feature.
A check is in place for the ping limiter ensuring there are worlds with a lower ping than what is provided in the config. If there are none or the provided value is 0, then it won't check and will warn the player.

nodes.bodyText: I don't see any reason to have this? There is already logic to handle if it cannot find a world to hop to, which seems fine?
This will crash if there is no ping
